summary: Replaces all of the vanilla banner textures with custom ones.
descriptionHtml:
[IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img16/6330/frontpagenew.png[/IMG]

PLEASE READ!!
- if you installed the 0.02 you need to delete the meshes that were installed they can be found in your game dir under data/meshes/clutter/banners. Delete everything in that folder and you should be all set.

[IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img38/8670/changelogt.png[/IMG]

Version 1.5
- Well I thought I got em all .... now I DO!
- New options to choose from download the "Swanky Options" file and follow the read me
- fixed some alpha issues
- fixed issue with the pennants in Solitude, they are there now
- Uploaded my PSD files for the community, welcome

Version 1.0
- Minor Tweaks to almost all banners
- All the banners are done!!!

Version 0.04
- fixed file path error for College Banner (thanks WBizzyW)
- small tweaks to all banners
- added Hrothgar, Morthal, and Dawnstar banners

Version 0.03
- removed custom meshes were causing some banners to vanish (fixed)
- Winterhold College Banner

Version 0.02:
- changed the UV layouts of the clutter banner meshes
- New normal map for clutter banners and Whiterun inside banners
- Falkreath, Riften, and Solitude first version banners
- Generic Banners


[IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img39/1225/faqpv.png[/IMG]

Q: What does the mod mess with?
A: Just some textures for the banners (for now), and some meshes for the banners
Q: AWW but I don't want to install the options manually .....
A: ..... well thats nice, but seriously I am working on an installer cause I will need one for the next batch of stuff I'm working on
Q: I like you artwork but man its just not to my taste and I don't have the artistic talent to use you psd files to complete my pristine visage
A: Do you have the ability to type and discuss as a sensable human being, then pop over to the discussion forums, remember DISCUSSION not REQUEST. I am open minded, not a texture slave.


[IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img195/7513/creditsjg.png[/IMG]

Thanks to the wonderful artists at Deviant Art. I have far too many of their brushes on my computer to remember where it came from, so if you see your work used please let me know and I would be more than happy to credit you by name.

[url="http://www.deviantart.com"]Deviant Art[/url]

Suggestions and Critiques always welcome.

Cheers,

KEBW1144
author: KEBW1144
